title: Textile, 1820–40
medium:
Medium: cotton
Technique: printed by engraved roller on plain weave
block printed on plain weave
printed by engraved copper plate on plain weave
dimensions:
H x W: 48.8 x 31 cm (19 3/16 x 12 3/16 in.)
Repeat H: 33 cm (13 in.)
creditline: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. G. Glen Gould
description: On white ground, vertical pattern of large swag of roses centered on rising serpentine of tendrils, from which spring sprays of small leaves. Roses, tendrils, and all outlines delicately printed in red, probably by copper-plate, with green and blue leaves carelessly overprinted by block. Left selvage present.
